page.title: 06More Holwell Ecology
page.content:
The flora and fauna which are decreasing are cowslips, oxlips, snakes-head fritillary, barn owl, tawny owl, bats, adders,grass-snakes, frogs and toads.
The largest field in the surveyed area is of 25 acres. All the fields are bordered by ditches and hedges of hawthorn, blackthorn, hazel, maple, and happily, elm. Mallard, teal and heron are found on the one and a quarter acre lake, which nurtures eel, tench, perch and roach.
The average annual rainfall is 34 inches. Dutch elm disease has killed all the elm trees over the last 15 years.
